bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 50 (Friday, March 17, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. JACKSON of Texas:H.R. 1632.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8 of the United States ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:to eliminate taxpayer funding for the National Public Radioand Public Broadcasting Service[Page H1295]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Communications and Technology.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
No Partisan Radio and Partisan Broadcasting Services Act or the NPR and PBS Act

This bill prohibits federal funding of National Public Radio (NPR) and the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS), including by prohibiting the use of federal funds received by a public broadcast station to pay dues to or purchase programming from NPR or PBS.

bill.title: NPR and PBS Act

item.title: No Partisan Radio and Partisan Broadcasting Services Act
To eliminate taxpayer funding for the partisan broadcasting outlets known as National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Communications and Technology.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
